channel.title: EasyRSC Help
channel.description:
I need help getting EasyRSC public, and with my compiler. I'll start with this-
When I tried to make EasyRSC public by editing the files to add my ip, I get this:
[img]http://img39.imageshack.us/img39/4170/internetsettings.jpg[/img] [code]Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li b\tools.jar Buildfile: build.xml
runclient: [java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect [java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect [java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect [java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect [java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect[/code]
Does anyone know why it didn't work, and how I can fix it?
I assume it had to do with my java compiler, but I'm not sure.
This happens when I try to compile server.java:
[code] ^ DelayedEventHandler.java:18: cannot find symbol symbol : class DelayedEvent location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler public boolean contains(DelayedEvent event) { ^ DelayedEventHandler.java:22: cannot find symbol symbol : class DelayedEvent location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler public ArrayList<DelayedEvent> getEvents() { ^ DelayedEventHandler.java:26: cannot find symbol symbol : class DelayedEvent location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler public void add(DelayedEvent event) { ^ DelayedEventHandler.java:32: cannot find symbol symbol : class DelayedEvent location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler public void remove(DelayedEvent event) { ^ DelayedEventHandler.java:36: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler public void removePlayersEvents(Player player) { ^ GameEngine.java:5: package org.apache.mina.common does not exist import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession; ^ GameEngine.java:6: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.event.DelayedEvent; ^ GameEngine.java:7: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SaveEvent; ^ GameEngine.java:8: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player; ^ GameEngine.java:9: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Shop; ^ GameEngine.java:10: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World; ^ GameEngine.java:11: package org.rscdaemon.server.net does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.net.PacketQueue; ^ GameEngine.java:12: package org.rscdaemon.server.net does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.net.RSCPacket; ^ GameEngine.java:13: package org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler.PacketHandler; ^ GameEngine.java:14: package org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler.PacketHandlerDef; ^ GameEngine.java:15: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.Logger; ^ GameEngine.java:16: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.PersistenceManager; ^ GameEngine.java:26: cannot find symbol symbol : class World location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine private static final World world = World.getWorld(); ^ GameEngine.java:30: cannot find symbol symbol : class PacketQueue location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine private PacketQueue<RSCPacket> packetQueue; ^ GameEngine.java:30: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine private PacketQueue<RSCPacket> packetQueue; ^ GameEngine.java:38: cannot find symbol symbol : class PacketHandler location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine private TreeMap<Integer, PacketHandler> packetHandlers = new TreeMap<Int eger, PacketHandler>(); ^ GameEngine.java:159: cannot find symbol symbol : class PacketQueue location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine public PacketQueue<RSCPacket> getPacketQueue() { ^ GameEngine.java:159: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine public PacketQueue<RSCPacket> getPacketQueue() { ^ GUI.java:18: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SaveEvent; ^ GUI.java:19: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem; ^ GUI.java:20: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player; ^ GUI.java:21: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World; ^ GUI.java:22: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.Config; ^ GUI.java:23: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.DataConversions; ^ GUI.java:24: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.Formulae; ^ GUI.java:25: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.Logger; ^ GUI.java:38: cannot find symbol symbol : class World location: class org.rscdaemon.server.GUI public static World world = World.getWorld(); ^ Server.java:3: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.event.DelayedEvent; ^ Server.java:4: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SingleEvent; ^ Server.java:5: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.util.*; ^ Server.java:6: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World; ^ Server.java:7: package org.rscdaemon.server.net does not exist import org.rscdaemon.server.net.RSCConnectionHandler; ^ Server.java:9: package org.apache.mina.common does not exist import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptor; ^ Server.java:10: package org.apache.mina.common does not exist import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptorConfig; ^ Server.java:11: package org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio does not exist import org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.*; ^ Server.java:29: cannot find symbol symbol : class World location: class org.rscdaemon.server.Server private static final World world = World.getWorld(); ^ Server.java:37: cannot find symbol symbol : class IoAcceptor location: class org.rscdaemon.server.Server private IoAcceptor acceptor; ^ Server.java:41: cannot find symbol symbol : class DelayedEvent location: class org.rscdaemon.server.Server private DelayedEvent updateEvent; ^ ClientUpdater.java:14: cannot find symbol symbol : variable World location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private static World world = World.getWorld(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:17: cannot find symbol symbol : class PlayerPositionPacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private PlayerPositionPacketBuilder playerPositionBuilder = new PlayerPo sitionPacketBuilder(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:18: cannot find symbol symbol : class PlayerUpdatePacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private PlayerUpdatePacketBuilder playerApperanceBuilder = new PlayerUpd atePacketBuilder(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol : class GameObjectPositionPacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private GameObjectPositionPacketBuilder gameObjectPositionBuilder = new GameObjectPositionPacketBuilder();
^ ClientUpdater.java:20: cannot find symbol symbol : class WallObjectPositionPacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private WallObjectPositionPacketBuilder wallObjectPositionPacketBuilder = new WallObjectPositionPacketBuilder();
^ ClientUpdater.java:21: cannot find symbol symbol : class ItemPositionPacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private ItemPositionPacketBuilder itemPositionBuilder = new ItemPosition PacketBuilder(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:22: cannot find symbol symbol : class NpcPositionPacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private NpcPositionPacketBuilder npcPositionPacketBuilder = new NpcPosit ionPacketBuilder(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:23: cannot find symbol symbol : class NpcUpdatePacketBuilder location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater private NpcUpdatePacketBuilder npcApperanceBuilder = new NpcUpdatePacket Builder(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:38: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player p : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:58: cannot find symbol symbol : class Npc location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Npc n : npcs) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:69: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player p : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:74: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player p : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:90: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player sender : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:91: cannot find symbol symbol : class ChatMessage location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater ChatMessage message = sender.getNextChatMessage(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:95: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player recipient : sender.getViewArea().getPlayersIn View()) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:111: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player player : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:117: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater Player affectedPlayer = player.getWishToTrade();
^ ClientUpdater.java:124: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater Player affectedPlayer = player.getWishToDuel(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:139: cannot find symbol symbol : class Player location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(Player p : players) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:140: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater List<RSCPacket> packets = p.getActionSender().getPackets (); ^ ClientUpdater.java:141: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater for(RSCPacket packet : packets) { ^ ClientUpdater.java:179: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater RSCPacket temp = npcPositionPacketBuilder.getPacket(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:190: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater RSCPacket temp = npcApperanceBuilder.getPacket(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:201: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater RSCPacket temp = wallObjectPositionPacketBuilder.getPacket(); ^ ClientUpdater.java:212: cannot find symbol symbol : class RSCPacket location: class org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater RSCPacket temp = gameObjectPositionBuilder.getPacket(); ^ 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
So, if anyone knows how to make server public, and fix the java compiler, then please help me. I tried searching through threads (yes with search button) but nothing helped.

item.title: EasyRSC Help
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

http://www.techpitcher.com/installing-apache-ant-in-windows.html

try this, ive been helping you under the assumption you already had ant downloaded and with the right path. Follow this guide and it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Help
item.dc:creator: @evilsmiley25 evilsmiley25
item.description:
@evilsmiley25 wrote:

[quote=“Mental Piracy, post:14, topic:326209”]Ok its showing none of your packing exists, so either you removed the “package” line in the top of your classes, moved the compiler out of the right directory or moved some of your packages to a different directory. For your “opening the server up” You will have to portforward to allow incoming connections to your IP. Without it you can only connect through localhost. Here is my compiler that works fine.

@echo off taskkill /F /IM java.exe set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk(your version) ant pause[/quote]

Help??

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Help
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

Ok its showing none of your packing exists, so either you removed the “package” line in the top of your classes, moved the compiler out of the right directory or moved some of your packages to a different directory. For your “opening the server up” You will have to portforward to allow incoming connections to your IP. Without it you can only connect through localhost. Here is my compiler that works fine.

@echo off taskkill /F /IM java.exe set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk(your version) ant pause

Read full topic

Or if anyone else has a solution to fix this, please post how.

item.title: EasyRSC Help
item.dc:creator: @evilsmiley25 evilsmiley25
item.description:
@evilsmiley25 wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:6, topic:326209”][quote author=evilsmiley25 link=topic=422624.msg3103761#msg3103761 date=1263940137]

Seems to me that you messed something up that is causing the 100+ errors during compiling. Start with a fresh copy of easyrsc (if you already havent done any edits to it) and try again.

I have, multiple times. I even tried compiling the same file, without editing it, after downloading a new copy, and it STILL gave me the 100 errors.

Just wondering…did you download and install JDK properly?

Yes, unless this was wrong:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

I don’t get what I’m doing wrong…I followed your guide, and I tried it 3 times now, but I still get that damn “100 errors”. Someone please help me, like maybe through TeamViewer or tell me what I’m doing wrong…

It can’t be just me. I have tried compiling other source files, not from this source, and they don’t return any errors. But, when I try for the server.java in EasyRSC, it NEVER works…What am I doing wrong???
[/quote]

Post what your editing.[/quote]
It’s all files in the EasyRSC that don’t compile, but I’ll list this one as an example.

[code]package org.rscdaemon.server;

import org.rscdaemon.server.event.DelayedEvent;
import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SingleEvent;
import org.rscdaemon.server.util.*;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World;
import org.rscdaemon.server.net.RSCConnectionHandler;

import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptor;
import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptorConfig;
import org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.*;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
import java.util.Properties;

import javax.swing.UIManager;

/**

  • The entry point for RSC server.
    /
    public class Server {
    /    *

    • World instance
      /
      private static final World world = World.getWorld();
      /      *
    • The game engine
      /
      private GameEngine engine;
      /      *
    • The SocketAcceptor
      /
      private IoAcceptor acceptor;
      /      *
    • Update event - if the server is shutting down
      /
      private DelayedEvent updateEvent;
      /      *
    • The login server connection
      /
      /      *
    • Is the server running still?
      */
      private boolean running;

    public boolean running() {
    return running;
    }

    /**

    • Shutdown the server in 60 seconds
      */
      public boolean shutdownForUpdate() {
      if(updateEvent != null) {
      return false;
      }
      updateEvent = new SingleEvent(null, 65000) {
      public void action() {
      kill();
      }
      };
      world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(updateEvent);
      return true;
      }

    /**

    • MS till the server shuts down
      */
      public int timeTillShutdown() {
      if(updateEvent == null) {
      return -1;
      }
      return updateEvent.timeTillNextRun();
      }

    public void resetOnline() {
    try {
    File files = new File(“players/”);
    int count = 0;
    for(File f : files.listFiles()) {

     	if(f.getName().endsWith(".cfg")) {
 		count++;
 		Properties pr = new Properties();

 		FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(f);
 		pr.load(fis);
 		fis.close();
 		pr.setProperty("loggedin",  "false");
 		FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(f);
 		pr.store(fos, "Character Data.");
 		fos.close();
 	}
 	
 }
 Logger.print(count + " Accounts exist.", 3);
 } catch (Exception e) {
 	Logger.print(e.toString(), 1);
 }

    }

    /**

    • Creates a new server instance, which in turn creates a new
    • engine and prepares the server socket to accept connections.
      */
      public Server() {
      resetOnline();
      running = true;
      world.setServer(this);
      try {
      engine = new GameEngine();
      engine.start();
      acceptor = new SocketAcceptor();
      IoAcceptorConfig config = new SocketAcceptorConfig();
      config.setDisconnectOnUnbind(true);
      ((SocketSessionConfig)config.getSessionConfig()).setReuseAddress(true);
      acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress(“localhost”, GameVars.portNumber), new RSCConnectionHandler(engine), config);
      }
      catch (Exception e) {
      Logger.error(e);
      }
      }

    /**

    • Returns the game engine for this server
      */
      public GameEngine getEngine() {
      return engine;
      }

    public boolean isInitialized() {
    return engine != null;
    }

    /**

    • Kills the game engine and irc engine
      */
      public void kill() {
      GUI.resetVars();
      Logger.print(“CleanRSC Shutting Down…”, 3);
      running = false;
      engine.emptyWorld();
      }

    /**

    • Unbinds the socket acceptor
      */
      public void unbind() {
      try {
      acceptor.unbindAll();
      GUI.cout(“Socket Closed”, 3);
      }
      catch(Exception e) { }
      }

    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
    try {

     	UIManager.setLookAndFeel("com.sun.java.swing.plaf.windows.WindowsLookAndFeel");
 	//UIManager.setLookAndFeel("com.easynth.lookandfeel.EaSynthLookAndFeel");
 } catch (Exception e) {
 		
 	}
 	GUI.args = args;
 new GUI();

    }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Help
item.dc:creator: @evilsmiley25 evilsmiley25
item.description:
@evilsmiley25 wrote:

I need help getting EasyRSC public, and with my compiler. I’ll start with this-

When I tried to make EasyRSC public by editing the files to add my ip, I get this:

[code]Unable to locate tools.jar. Expected to find it in C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\li
b\tools.jar
Buildfile: build.xml

runclient:
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
[java] java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect[/code]

Does anyone know why it didn’t work, and how I can fix it?

I assume it had to do with my java compiler, but I’m not sure.

This happens when I try to compile server.java:

[code] ^
DelayedEventHandler.java:18: cannot find symbol
symbol : class DelayedEvent
location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler
public boolean contains(DelayedEvent event) {
^
DelayedEventHandler.java:22: cannot find symbol
symbol : class DelayedEvent
location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler
public ArrayList getEvents() {
^
DelayedEventHandler.java:26: cannot find symbol
symbol : class DelayedEvent
location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler
public void add(DelayedEvent event) {
^
DelayedEventHandler.java:32: cannot find symbol
symbol : class DelayedEvent
location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler
public void remove(DelayedEvent event) {
^
DelayedEventHandler.java:36: cannot find symbol
symbol : class Player
location: class org.rscdaemon.server.DelayedEventHandler
public void removePlayersEvents(Player player) {
^
GameEngine.java:5: package org.apache.mina.common does not exist
import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;
^
GameEngine.java:6: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.event.DelayedEvent;
^
GameEngine.java:7: package org.rscdaemon.server.event does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SaveEvent;
^
GameEngine.java:8: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player;
^
GameEngine.java:9: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Shop;
^
GameEngine.java:10: package org.rscdaemon.server.model does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World;
^
GameEngine.java:11: package org.rscdaemon.server.net does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.net.PacketQueue;
^
GameEngine.java:12: package org.rscdaemon.server.net does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.net.RSCPacket;
^
GameEngine.java:13: package org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler.PacketHandler;
^
GameEngine.java:14: package org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler does not exist
import org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler.PacketHandlerDef;
^
GameEngine.java:15: package org.rscdaemon.server.util does not exist
